name: Fitzpatrick Castle Hotel Dublin

reviews.text: if your going on dun loaghaire or dublin port ferry,this hotel is very near both.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i booked it for above reason and wanted it as a start to our holiday so researched tripadvisor.
reviews.title: service with a smile

reviews.text: really enjoyed the park beside hotel , we were lucky , weather was sunny,enjoyed the walk to tower ,nice cafe on walkway up to tower ,great views there also.. lovely little village with dart ,about 5 mins drive away,we met up with friends there who got the dart in to meet us,ate in the club dalkey bar.
reviews.title: disappointing experience

reviews.text: we got family room at a good price ,room only.room was huge,best we have ever had,2 king size beds .and plenty of room to move about in.bathroom could do with new shower curtain but okay for one night.
reviews.title: Nice way to end our holiday

reviews.text: when you arrive ,hotel looks like a 5 star hotel,but closer inspection its not.
reviews.title: Beautiful family break away-

reviews.text: We recently had a pleasant stay in the hotel, we are two adults + 2 young boys. The visit started bad as the hotel had booked us in a twin room and it took some convincing and some email confirmations searches to convince staff we had already paid for a family room. However once the team realised there error a free bottle of wine was delivered to the room which was fair. I do love the hotels quirks and to me an older hotel with charecter and charm beats the soulless modern hotels hands down.. Staff were very friendly in general and I would recommend the hotel and location for a getaway. The restaurant does get extremely busy and food is slow coming and don't even think about ordering desert because they would not even entertain us and avoided our table like the plague when we finished our main which was disappointing. The chef seemed rude and openly jeered customers that had not got all of their order.. Note to chef customers can hear you blabbing!!
reviews.title: Are you sure you booked a family room? Really?

reviews.text: Stayed here two nights on the last leg of a 7 day Ireland tour. Get a room on the fifth floor with a balcony and a harbor view or be unhappy in a dark room with a view of a rooftop. We loved our stay here. No, it's not a castle, just a big hotel tarted up to resemble one. But, located in an Exceptionally nice neighborhood southeast of Dublin with astounding views. Good food and drink on site (good, not great), nice folks and good service. Happy as clams with our stay at the Fitzpatrick.
reviews.title: It all depends on the room...

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights and had a very good experience. Service, staff and food all to a high standard. Lovely scenic location. Would be very happy to make a return visit. Great walks nearby with stunning views.
reviews.title: Great central hotel in a wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another break at this beautiful hotel, where the service is excellent and the welcome warm. We had a special two day treat to celebrate birthdays and the upgrade we were given made our stay all the more enjoyable. Thank you Jessica. Food as always was excellent though I always find Dublin hotel bar prices far too expensive. We, however, will be back again.
reviews.title: Relaxing venue

reviews.text: Went to Fitzpatricks for weekend in July and loved evry minute of it. First massive thanks goes to Sandra who was amazing and helpful even before we arrived, and when we got there she shuffled things around for us to get a balcony room, on 4th floor with fantasic views and no doubt the weather helped but I woudl have sat there rain or snow it was a panoramic over dublin coastline and it made our break very special. thank you Sandra.
reviews.title: King of the Castle's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fitzpatrick (formerly Killiney Castle Hotel) at the beginning of our holiday and it was a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Lovely views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a suite and they gave us one at the corner with uninterrupted views of Dublin Bay and Dun Laoghaire harbour. I could have sat on the balcony and played harbour master all day.
reviews.title: Great location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was great and any need was promptly attended to.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing break

reviews.text: Like others we found breakfast was a bit pricey. We had it one morning, but found the cafes in Dalkey to be a bit cheaper.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel, with great facilities and if Dublin is not your intended point of interest then this is a great place to call home. Personally I am well beyond finding Dublin of any interest and as such this hotel is the perfect location to base yourself in.
reviews.title: good choice for short break

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in March 2008 as I was attending a wedding at the hotel.
reviews.title: Great for Weddings !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good Points: Good service- I checked in and the receptionist knew I was with the wedding party and handed me an envelope with all the wedding details. I was quite impressed with the breakfast buffet, a good choice of hot and cold food was on offer. The gym and swimming pool where of a good standard. The hotel requires all guests to wear swimming hats. The hotel grounds where well kept and a nice place to have wedding photos taken. The best part about this whole stay was the standard of the food at the wedding, it was 5 courses it came out quick, hot and tasted great.
reviews.title: wonderful mid week break

reviews.text: Bad points: The room I stayed in was a little dated especially the bathroom. The room was also baking hot I had the window open the whole stay, and this was in March!! Also I had some bad service on my first night in the downstairs restaurant the (waiter forgot a drink and a few other bits) but I am sure this was just a one off as the rest of the service on my stay was fine.
reviews.title: A lovely relaxing family break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over all I would recomend this hotel and I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great hotel outside Diblin

likes.liked: — Size of the room and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we have just returned from a mid week break at hotel having had a wonderful time.when we arrived we were upgraded to a beautiful newly refurbished suite by an extremely helpful receptionist maria .the hotel is only five minutes walk from the quaint village dalkey which has numerous restaurants and bars to suit anyones needs.all the staff in hotel were very friendly and the food was great especially in dungeon grill which was very reasonably priced.would highly recommend this hotel for a romantic break or indeed a family break as the leisure facilities are excellent.great location as you are only a twenty minute journey on the dart from dublin if you want to visit the city.looking forward to return visit.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with good and bad points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on the previous reviews, I had very high expectations. Our stay was fine, but for some reason I felt something was missing. We had a few hiccups with check in. We were supposed to have an early check-in, but when we arrived it fell through. At the time, we were told we'd already been booked in the larger room with balcony and view of the harbor. When we actually got our room there was no balcony or view and the clerk (the same one we had talked to two hours earlier) had no record of the balcony. The room was very large, to the point that I'm not sure what we were supposed to do with all that room. The bedding and furniture were a little shabby. The bathroom was also a good size, but could have used a really good scrubbing. The public areas were pretty, but the business center was disappointing (no internet access during the entire stay). We had dinner in the Dungeon. The food was very good but they were short staffed and the place was incredibly noisy. We had lunch down the hill in Dalkey at Finnigan's. I highly recommend the place -- great food and beautiful place. It was our last night before going to the Dublin airport. I guess I was expecting to be pampered/royal treatment. It felt more like a very nice Marriott.
reviews.title: Nice, but expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for just one night in order to do some sightseeing in Dublin city the following day before moving on with the rest of our trip.
reviews.title: Only stayed for one night, but a really nice place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very impressive set in lovely grounds overlooking Dublin bay, although our room was looking at another part of the building. No problem for us as we were there just for one evening, I am sure they would have moved us if we were staying longer and had asked. Very friendly people for a large hotel.
reviews.title: Out Of The City But First class hotel

likes.disliked: — The carpet in the bedroom and the lace cutain

reviews.text: Pool was great, but the bar prices were a little high to say the least.
reviews.title: Great, but still missed something.

likes.disliked: — The room was worn and in need of updates

reviews.text: We had a hire car for our trip and we parked at the Dart station car park (popular, so go early for a spot) for the 20 min ride into Dublin city - best way to do it I think. Then we took an open top bus to get some sightseeing done. The live comentary from the driver was outstanding - he was so funny we went all the way around on his tour before stopping at some vantage points such as Guinness brewery. Then back on the bus as the ticket lasts 24 hours 'hop on hop off' system - great. All drivers are informative but the first one had definately kissed the Blarney stone.
reviews.title: Enjoy Dublin But Stay Here!

reviews.text: Just returned to the UK having spent a pleasant 5 day break at the Killiney Castle. I have to admit I was brought up within walking distance of the hotel and stayed here previously some 5 years ago and have attended a number of functions at the hotel over the years.
reviews.title: Enjoyable 5 day break
Very traditional.
reviews.text: We stayed here to attend a family wedding nearby and can only say the staff here are a real credit to the hotel. No matter where you were in the hotel and you met a member of staff you were greeted with a hello and a a smile. Nothing was ever to much trouble and everyone was very helpful throughout our stay.
The only niggles we found were with housekeeping and the initial standard of cleanliness of our room was not maintained by staff during our stay.
reviews.title: Between Average & Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our final morning breakfast was a little chaotic to say the least with tea and toast arriving eventually.To be fair it was very busy and the staff were working hard and the management team seemed to step in and save the day. Sticking with the breakfast which is buffet and is of excellent quality and plentiful.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel on the outskirts of Dublin

reviews.text: We ate out in nearby Dalkey during our stay so I cannot comment on what the evening meals on offer were like.
reviews.title: Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancé and I were staying in Dublin to watch our daughter compete in an athletics event (for Welsh Schools), so we thought for once we would go a bit more up market.
reviews.title: Lost & Found !!!

reviews.text: The Fitzpatrick Castle was a little difficult to find, as our sat nav didn't want to play ball, but when we did find it we knew we had made the right choice. A 4 poster bed in a larger than expected room.
reviews.title: Coffee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff on reception were so helpful, making us feel so welcome. We needed directions to the athletics track on the other side of Dublin, Cara gave us directions to the motorway from the hotel and then to the track, and everywhere else we wanted to visit over our two night stay.
reviews.title: Directions to Bono's house? Yes, please!

reviews.text: Killiney has a lovely beach (pebbly - no sand) with cracking views, it is flanked by the Dublin Dart Railway which we used to make a trip into Dublin (around 25mins) on the Sunday with free parking.
reviews.title: Great for a family break.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back at the hotel, we had a fab breakfast on both mornings, plenty of choice for all tastes. We ate on the Friday night in the Dungeon Grill Restaurant - food and staff were faultless. The spa was fine, even-though we had to purchase swim caps. I cant believe I'm going to moan about the weather, but during our stay we did have some of the warmest temps in Britain and the only downside was the lack air-con in the bedrooms or even a fan - it was absolutely stifling.
reviews.title: Luxuary all The Way

reviews.text: Overall a nice hotel. The attached restaurant was a bit expensive, but the food very good nonetheless (steak/seafood).
reviews.title: Business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have no idea if there's much to do in the area as was on business, but swimming pool/gym looked good and the bar was well stocked.
reviews.title: Was I at another hotel?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Er, I really can not reconcile the reviews below with the Hotel I stayed at. The hotel is really tired, you know, dusty smells, threadbare carpets, peeling wallpaper, smelly bathrooms. The pool was bizarre, rules for everything including having to wear swim caps? Sorry this is just about a poor 3 star hotel. Its old worn out and needs a re-vamp. The dungeon bar and grill however was very pleasant, although the service was slow and not that up to date. For instance the wine was not chilled so the waitress offered to put ice in the wine? We would not return.
reviews.title: A Class Act

likes.disliked: — BEING SO REMOTE(BOTH A GOOD & A BAD THING!)

reviews.text: This is one of those hotels that is not what it seems,often marketed as the DUBLIN CASTLE HOTEL,this gives the impression that it is in(or at least is walking distance from) the city of Dublin & that it is a castle-WRONG!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll tackle the castle bit first,it is one of those old buildings which was a large house which somebody decided to build (roughly) in the manner of a castle & called it such,I guess 'cos they wanted to!
reviews.title: A real Irish hotel!

description: Fitzpatrick Castle Dublin is the epitome of the elegance and charm of the south Dublin coast. The only hotel located in the fashionable suburbs of Killiney and Dalkey, overlooking Dublin Bay. Fitzpatrick Castle is only 9 miles/20 minutes from downtown Dublin. Luxurious bedrooms and suites decorated in the traditional castle style are also renovated to the highest spec with ISDN lines and in-house entertainment system in all rooms. Wireless broadband Internet access is available in most public areas of hotel.
